intro: Barleria mollis, commonly known as the velvetleaf barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features opposite, hairy, ovate leaves that are often tinged with red or purple. Its showy, tubular flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in clusters. Barleria mollis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
